- Board: Q-high but paired with an Ace; hearts present two-tone texture.  
- Strength: we have TPTK, which is strong HU.  
- Villain calling pre-flop has plenty of “middle hands”. We beat their pairs and draws, lose to AQ/A7/77/QQ.  
- Pot already 120. With stacks of 920/960 effective, we are still ~96 BB deep, so sizable bets possible.

Plan: go for value—we dominate a lot of hands like KQ, QJ, K♥J♥, etc. Standard ⅔ pot stab (~80) polarises for value and collects dead money if they missed.  

[Bet 80]

- EV for a steal: we cannot out-last the opponent by merely folding; they’re one big-blind ahead (990 vs 980).

- Position: post-flop OOP, but effective 49 BB deep provides plenty of leverage.  
- ICM pressure: last hand tempers value but raises the value of aggression and fold-equity.

To maximize equity:  
1. Push pre-flop when we have positive EV.  
2. Ineffective mission: waiting for better cards won’t recover the blind deficit; we must force a fold or build a pot we’re ahead in.

Given these, best line is a shove. It denies equity to the bottom ~50 % of the BB’s range (7-2o, 9-3o, etc.) and wins outright ~55 % of the time; when called we still have ~35 % vs a random ‘call-shove’ subset (any two cards at least Q-7, 6-5, etc.).

Calculations simplified: shove EV ≈ 0.45 * 990 + 0.55 * 980 – trivial positive.

[All-in 960]
